subject: Climate & Environment
title: Solar Energy After Dark
description: A quick, practical guide to Solar Energy After Dark.

hook.text: The sun sets every evening. Critics love pointing out that solar doesn't work at night.

buildup.text: But concentrated solar plants store heat in molten salt that stays hot for hours.

discovery.text: The Gemasolar plant in Spain ran for 36 straight days â€” including nights â€” on stored heat.

twist.text: Battery prices dropped 90% in a decade, making nighttime solar storage practical everywhere.

climax.text: Pairing panels with batteries turns solar from a daytime source into an anytime source.

punchline.text: Solar doesn't stop at sunset. It just saves some for later.

quiz.question: How did the Gemasolar plant generate power at night?
